intro: Plectranthus scutellarioides, commonly known as purple deadnettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple, pink, or white, which bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
